name: Bash Seaworld Basics
description: Learn Bash scripting with sea creatures and ocean adventures

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
whale_name="Blue Whale"
ocean_depth=200
is_endangered=true

echo "Creature: $whale_name"
echo "Diving depth: $ocean_depth meters"
echo "Endangered status: $is_endangered"
snippets.title: Variables and Output
snippets.description: Basic variables and echo commands with whale data

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
read -p "Enter dolphin name: " dolphin_name
read -p "Enter pod size: " pod_size

echo "Welcome $dolphin_name!"
echo "Your pod has $pod_size dolphins"
echo "Swimming in the deep blue sea..."
snippets.title: User Input with Dolphins
snippets.description: Reading user input and displaying dolphin pod information

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
shark_speed=50
min_speed=30

if [ $shark_speed -gt $min_speed ]; then
  echo "Great White is fast enough to hunt!"
else
  echo "Shark needs to swim faster"
fi
echo "Current speed: $shark_speed km/h"
snippets.title: Conditionals with Sharks
snippets.description: If-else statements for comparing shark speeds

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
for sea_animal in whale dolphin shark turtle octopus; do
  echo "Spotted a $sea_animal in the ocean!"
  echo "Adding to marine life log..."
done
echo "Marine survey complete"
snippets.title: For Loops with Sea Animals
snippets.description: Iterating through a list of marine creatures

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
plankton_count=1
max_plankton=1000

while [ $plankton_count -le $max_plankton ]; do
  echo "Plankton #$plankton_count floating by"
  plankton_count=$((plankton_count * 2))
done
echo "Plankton bloom observed!"
snippets.title: While Loops with Plankton
snippets.description: While loop demonstrating plankton population growth

snippets.title: Functions for Fish Counting
snippets.description: Creating functions with parameters for marine biology

snippets.title: Case Statements for Sea Creatures
snippets.description: Using case statements to classify marine animals

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
sea_creatures=("whale" "shark" "dolphin" "octopus" "jellyfish")
echo "Total creatures: ${#sea_creatures[@]}"
echo "First creature: ${sea_creatures[0]}"
echo "All creatures: ${sea_creatures[@]}"
sea_creatures+=("seahorse")
echo "Added seahorse: ${sea_creatures[@]}"
snippets.title: Arrays of Marine Life
snippets.description: Working with arrays to store sea creature data

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
echo "Creating ocean depth log..."
echo "Depth,Creature,Temperature" > ocean_log.csv
echo "100,Tuna,18C" >> ocean_log.csv
echo "500,Squid,12C" >> ocean_log.csv
echo "1000,Anglerfish,4C" >> ocean_log.csv
echo "Ocean log created successfully!"
snippets.title: File Operations for Ocean Data
snippets.description: Creating and writing to files with marine data

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
if [ -f "ocean_log.csv" ]; then
  echo "Reading ocean data:"
  cat ocean_log.csv
  echo "Total entries: $(wc -l < ocean_log.csv)"
else
  echo "Ocean log not found!"
fi
snippets.title: Reading Ocean Files
snippets.description: Checking file existence and reading marine data

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
ocean_temp=$(echo "scale=2; 15.5 + 2.3" | bc)
water_pressure=$(echo "$ocean_temp * 1.5" | bc)
echo "Ocean temperature: ${ocean_temp}Â°C"
echo "Water pressure: $water_pressure atm"
echo "Conditions suitable for coral growth"
snippets.title: Ocean Mathematics
snippets.description: Calculating ocean conditions with floating point math

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
find_treasure() {
  local depth=$1
  if [ $depth -gt 50 ]; then
    echo "Diving to $depth meters..."
    echo "Found sunken treasure chest!"
  else
    echo "Too shallow, keep diving deeper"
  fi
}

find_treasure 25
find_treasure 75
snippets.title: Deep Sea Treasure Hunt
snippets.description: Functions with conditionals for underwater exploration

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
for depth in {10..100..10}; do
  if [ $((depth % 30)) -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "Depth $depth: Coral reef zone"
  else
    echo "Depth $depth: Open water"
  fi
done
snippets.title: Ocean Zone Mapping
snippets.description: Using range loops and modulo for depth zones

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
echo "Marine life spotted today:" | tee daily_log.txt
echo "Dolphins: 8" | tee -a daily_log.txt
echo "Whales: 2" | tee -a daily_log.txt
echo "Sharks: 1" | tee -a daily_log.txt
echo "Log saved and displayed!"
snippets.title: Marine Life Logging
snippets.description: Using tee command to log marine observations

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
grep -i "whale" ocean_log.csv | while read line; do
  echo "Whale sighting: $line"
  echo "Alerting marine biologists..."
done
echo "Whale monitoring complete"
snippets.title: Whale Tracking Pipeline
snippets.description: Using pipes and while loops for data processing

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
set -e
backup_dir="/tmp/ocean_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d)"
mkdir -p "$backup_dir"
cp *.csv "$backup_dir" 2>/dev/null || echo "No CSV files found"
echo "Ocean data backed up to $backup_dir"
snippets.title: Ocean Data Backup
snippets.description: Error handling and date formatting for backups

snippets.title: Temperature Monitoring System
snippets.description: Infinite loops for real-time ocean monitoring

snippets.title: Sonar Data Processing
snippets.description: Advanced function with error handling and return values

snippets.code:
#!/bin/bash
export OCEAN_RESEARCH_STATION="Pacific Deep"
export DIVE_DEPTH_LIMIT=200

echo "Research Station: $OCEAN_RESEARCH_STATION"
echo "Maximum dive depth: $DIVE_DEPTH_LIMIT meters"
echo "Environment configured for deep sea research!"
snippets.title: Ocean Research Environment
snippets.description: Setting up environment variables for marine research

snippets.title: Automated Ocean Reports
snippets.description: Complex script combining multiple concepts for reporting
